item.title: Writing in the Sciences - Cut the Clutter
item.description: This is an overview over the first chapter of Writing in the Sciences offered by Stanford . The secret of good writing is to strip every sentence to its cleanest components. Every word that serves no function, every long word that could be a short word, every adverb that carries the same meaning that’s already in the verb, every passive construction that leaves the reader unsure of who is doing what.
